title: Is there anybody who knows what happened 80 years ago today? - Quora

response.answer_text: July 7 1937 was a wednesday, and the big buzz in Chicago (where i’m from) was the hunt for Amelia Earheart who went missing five days earlier. On July 7 the U.S was making plans to search the Pheonix Islands for her crashed plane. Robert Worth Bingham was the U.S ambassador to the U.K and he made a speach on July 6 about European dictators which angered the leaders of Germany and Italy. The speech also angered American isolationists since Bingham said the U.S would win the next war with Britain against Germany if it had to happen. (I would have added more, but all the newspapers I found from 80 years ago today were mostly talking about the hunt for Amelia)

Marco Polo Bridge Incident - the start of the Second World War in Asia. Peel Commission - A UK government committee set up to decide what to do with the newly aquired territory of Israel/Palastine recommends partitioning the region.
